Class Polynomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • Polynomial
  • public class Polynomial
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a polynomial with real coefficients
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Asquator

      static double STANDARD_X_ERROR

      Constructs a polynomial from another one

      • getRoots

        public double[] getRoots​(double min,
                         double max,
                         double error)
        Finds all roots of the given polynomial in the given interval. If the polynomial is a constant zero, returns an array with maximal double value.
        Parameters:
        min - the a endpoint
        max - the b endpoint
        error - the desired accuracy
        Returns:
        Array of roots of the given polynomial. If the polynomial is a constant zero, returns an array with max. double value.

      • getExtremaPoints

        public Point[] getExtremaPoints​(double min,
                                double max,
                                double error)
        Finds and returns an array of strict extremum points in the given interval
        Parameters:
        min - the a endpoint
        max - the b endpoint
        error - the desired error
        Returns:
        array of strict extremum points in the given interval.

      • getInflectionPoints

        public Point[] getInflectionPoints​(double min,
                                   double max,
                                   double error)
        Finds inflection points in the given interval and returns an array of them.
        Parameters:
        min - the a endpoint
        max - the b endpoint
        error - the desired error
        Returns:
        an array of inflection points in a given interval with the desired error

      • displayAnalyticalInfo

        public void displayAnalyticalInfo​(double min,
                                  double max,
                                  double error)
        Prints analytical information about the polynomial on a given interval
        Parameters:
        min - the a endpoint
        max - the b endpoint
        error - the desired accuracy (default: 1E-5)

      • displayAnalyticalInfo

        public void displayAnalyticalInfo​(double min,
                                  double max)
        Displays analytical info about the polynomial, such as roots, extrema points, inflection points in the given interval
        Parameters:

        max - the b endpoint
